pros: Free parking. Lots of longevity in hospital staff.
cons: Insurance coverage not the best.

review_title: Value driven work but pay is not there.
pros: Great managers and coworkers. If you love helping the community at large this is the place where you can see how you make an impact.
cons: Pay is not one that keep up with true costs of life. Everyone in the department complains about the pay and unfortunately there is no hope for true change. You manager may attempt to get you something better but their hands are tied.

review_title: Hospital with a big heart and a challenging budget
pros: The staff at all levels are professional and competent, with all the right training and intention. Good people. Aspirational culture. Enjoyed the passion of the people who work there.
cons: Due to its location in a very financially challenged community, it has chronic financial problems. It has a very hard time meeting its goals because of money troubles. Sometimes that means workforce reductions or painful budget cuts. I would recommend to a friend who was willing to accept that risk.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lawrence, MA
pros: This was a very flexible position in the hospital clinic. I was able grow within office and count on a supportive team.
cons: The community is not always considerate of the appointment times and office rules.

pros: Flexible schedule and overtime opportunities
cons: Management on the floor was terrible

cons: Poor leadership and no defined objectives. Not the brightest available.Bwe

cons: Immature groups, lack of respect between staff. Lots of bickering. Hopefully Lawrence makes changes

pros: Good nursing union, 4:1 nurse to patient ratio
cons: No manager, broken equipment, stressful

review_title: It doesn't have the greatest nursing culture
job_title: ICU RN, BSN in Byfield, MA
pros: It's a union hospital so the pay is good and the union really fights for your rights as an employee. You can move up to different departments quickly if you are looking to advance your career.
cons: The work place culture is not great. A lot of bullying that is allowed by management.

pros: Helping a underprivileged community, feeling a sense of community with both patients and staff.
cons: Although they are union there have been issues with retaining staff causing unsafe nurse to patient ration. There are many reasons there is few staff one due to lack of leadership. Management could use serious improvement. Hospital only cares about revenue not about wellbeing of staff. There is also a huge lack of diversity especially in leadership roles.

pros: Great staff, works wells as a team.
cons: Lack of an immediate supervisor

review_title: No longer at the top of their game
pros: This hospital is small enough to not feel lost in  but large enough to be able to offer valuable resources to the community. It is an easy commute with free parking. The pay structure for nurses is very competitive and hard to beat.
cons: Leadership is non-supportive of their nursing  staff. They pay nurses well but this is only because of an established Union from many years ago. They used to have the most talented nurses in the state but now have nurses with little training. They have eliminated the education department which prevents these nurses from growing professionally and delivering high quality health care.

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Lawrence, MA
pros: They finally have a real coffee shop in that building.  The hospital is large enough that you can transfer departments if you want, but small enough that you can still stay friendly with your past co-workers.
cons:
It is always the assistants fault no matter what floor you are on.  The nurses run that place and if you do not have an RN next to your name, your opinion is not valued if heard at all.
The worst is the bullying culture.  Not only is it tolerated but in many cases allowed by the management.  There are an amazing amount of stories of older nurses tearing into younger ones and completely demoralizing them.  The other is the nurses aganist the support staff.  They are support staff, not nurse slaves.
The pay is not graded at any other position besides nursing.  The pay raises are a joke, assuming you get one.

pros:
Low patient ratios, yet nurses still found reasons to complain about their assignment. 

Pay is good courtesy of union
cons:
EMR is ancient and impossible to get comfortable with 

Policies are unclear or not defined at all

Hospital did away with evening cafeteria hours (closed at 3pm)  meaning the evening staff were unable to buy dinner from the cafeteria. 

Gunshots could be heard frequently, yet no security presence. Despite being told so in orientation. 

Overall attitude of the staff RNs were miserable. Constantly complaining. No teamwork. Seniority meant sticking an incompetent nurse with a poor assignment and eye rolling whenever said nurse requested help/advice. 

No wound team so patient wounds are going improperly treated 

IV is not pleased when being bothered 

Nurses are expected to do the work of a nurse and a pharmacist. Which is highly dangerous.

pros: Patient ratios are pretty good. Good PTO and pay.
cons: Gossip, backstabbing and intimidation by staff. People don’t admit their mistakes and ty to blame other. No root cause analysis done when mistakes are reported. Nurses try to built themselves up by tearing others down. New grad program does not offer classes with technical info- only how do you feel meetings. Felt like a complete waste of time. This job was my first nursing job and made me regret becoming a nurse. Staff going to management instead of following proper channels with complaints

review_title: Great learning experience and helpful staff
pros:
-Pay is fair.
-PTO and benefits are decent
-Friendly co-workers
-Plenty of shifts to work
cons:
-Community can be challenging to work with
-Management plays favorites
-Benefits are being stripped away 
-Not a lot of room for advancement

review_title: One of the last community hospitals in Massachusetts
pros: Lots of opportunities to improve systems and processes. Generally very friendly and hard-working people and managers. Located in a relatively safe area of Lawrence. Outstanding emergency room services. Cafeteria prices are reasonable.
cons: Health insurance benefits force you to stay local for care, even when there aren't many options. This makes getting second opinions very difficult.

pros:
There is always an opportunity to find extra hours on different floors. 
For the most part, the people are friendly and helpful.
Pay differential for night and weekend shifts.
cons:
Poor Management.
Supervisors play favorites. 
Definitely a hierarchy of importance and if you aren't near the top, can become an unprofessional environment. 
Not much room for advancement, unless you are involved in direct patient care. 
Not a career. This is a job.

pros: Good place to work. All departments are great to work in. Employees will help with any assistance needed.
cons:
Benefits could be better. 
Insurance is not very good as the deductible is higher than normal. More out of pocket for the employee
No opportunities to advance.

pros: some people can relate with your everyday life in the work space but are very demanding when there involved in the process
cons: you get stepped on frequently, management doesn't back you on situations even if your right and its a everyone for themselves environment

pros: I liked the work.  I liked the people that worked with me.  Our supervisors were fair.
cons: There was not opportunity for advancement in our department.

pros: Because i love the way they treat every patient  and also they love the hospital because the good care and treatment
cons: To provide the best care, give all the love and support to the family went they need.

cons: PTO Vacation and Holidays are combined together. The insurance is not good does not cover alot of specialist

cons: Management was not supportive, but if you did something wrong they made sure you knew it.
